name: 柯萊恩
objective:
本課程旨在提昇學生撰寫結構完整段落和短文之能力, 並著重如何重寫、摘要、 轉述、 陳述、筆記、編排、起草、修改等相關技巧。

The first semester of this two semester course will introduce students to ways to interact with key texts, which, though quite brief (usually 1 page in length) bring to bear of the highest level of perception, insight and exposition of the literary art. Students will be asked to respond to model texts in a manner in some way redolent of the original source—usually some key masterpiece from world literature.  Student responses may explore  imaginatively constructed experiences in writing as suggested by the source text, or may adapt the formal considerations of the source text, which themselves can never be fully disentangled from content.  There is no role in this class for Wikipedia or other such garbage-heaps of watered-down descriptions and puerile analyses.  Everything you must write down, except for a few approved secondary source texts under special occassions, must derive from either the original source text or follow as a development of the student’s own writing practice as it encounters this course of study as well as the works of fellow classmates. Class will often be conducted in a workshop manner, and students will be expected to share their works with their classmates on a regular basis.
